result.execSummary:
The defendant Greggery A. Hofmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Attend School or maintain employment at his agent's discretion.
At his agent's discretion, complete a psychological evaluation and follow through with the recommended treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal substances, or have any drug paraphernalia.
Shall have no contact with the victim.  No contact with victim's immediate family unless this is approved by the agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant enter, participate in, and successfully complete any assessment, evluations and/or treatment programs directed by his agent.  He may not withdraw from the program unless specific permission is given by his agent and/or treatment provider.
Defendant shall take any medications prescribed by the treating physician.
Defendant shall cooperate with and complete domestic violence/anger management treatment and a criminal thinking cognitive program.
Provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission and pay the DNA surcharge.
Defendant shall cooperate with and complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
 Good time granted.
Concurrent with: With prison term imposed on Ct. 1 in this case.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No errors or ommissions in the PSI reports.  Sentencing arguments.  On Count 1 the court imposed 5 years of Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 2 years initial confinement and 3 years of extended supervision, with 204 days sentence credit.  On Ct. 2 - six months of incarceration, concurrent to the prison term and payment of court costs.  Conditions of extended supervision on Ct. 1 are as follows:  Maintain absolute sobriety; attend, participate in, and successfully complete any assessment, evlauations and/or treatment programs directed by his agent.  He can't withdraw from the program unless he's given specific permission from the agent and treatment provider; take medications prescribed by trating physician; cooperate and complete and AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment; at agent's discretion complete a psychological evaluation and follow through with the recommeded treatment; cooperate with and complete domestic violence/anger management treatment; cooperate with and complete a criminal thinking cognitive program; not to possess or consume and alcohol or illegal substances or have any drug paraphernalia; either attend school or maintain employment at his agent's discretion; submit a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge; pay court costs and supervion fees; not possess any firearms; and no contact with victim or victim's immediate family, unless this is approved by the agent.  Court found DE eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Denying Request to Remove No Contact Order
to Inspect Juvenile Court Records
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on record.  State moved to amend Ct. 1 to 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety per statute 941.30(2).  Granted.  Plea of no contest to Ct. 1 and 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty, and ordered entry of JOC. Pursuant to the agreement remaining counts are dismissed and read in on motion of the state.  Pre-sentence investigation requested and ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint.  Preliminary hearing waived by the DE.  Court found waiver given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently, and bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state mirroring the complaint.  Further reading waived, and a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect entered by the DE.  PTC set.  Bond continued.  Court appointed Dr. Galli to conduct the NGI exam.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on examiner's report - the court finds the DE is competent to proceed.  Attorney Wolff concedes.
Competency hearing on July 15, 2014 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Justin D Wolff.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency issue raised and Mr. Wolff feels initial appearance is not proper at this time.  Requested the matter be kept on for the competency hearing on 07-28-2014 and continue with initial appearance afterwards.  Granted.

Taylor County Arrest Report

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.R.K. dob: 12-17-1990; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; no possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $5000.00 cash bond with conditions of:  comply with booking; no contact with C.R.K. dob: 12-17-1990; not possess or consume a controlled substance wihtout a valid prescription; no firearms or dangerous weapons.  Court ordered a $500 cash bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 07-01-2014 at 1:00 p.m.
